result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven L. Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
53 days credit if revoked from Probation. 
22CF544 dismissed and read in.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven L. Gardner

records.addlTxt: See plea hearing for details as to the waiver.

9:00 AM cases 22CF278, 22CF544, 22CF591 called. Defendant Steven L. Gardner in court.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Steven L. Gardner.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. There is an agreement. In all files: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver.  Information in each case to be filed by the State will mirror the criminal complaints. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
In 22CF278: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the Criminal Complaint. 
In 22CF591: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the Criminal Complaint. 
Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentencing is placed on Probation for 2 years with conditions: 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
60 day in Jail with Huber/EM, all Stayed pending further order of the court- Applies to Count 1 in 22CF278 only. 
Defendant to pay court costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Defendant has 53 days credit in 22CF544 and 6 days in 22CF591 if revoked from Probation.
Plea hearing on September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on September 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Case called at 9:42 AM.
Defendant Steven L. Gardner appeared in court with Attorney Melissa Petersen. Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Petersen requests new RTN date.
RTN: 7/14/22 at 9:30 AM.

Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended criminal complaint. Bond and hearing dates have previously been set. Return to court: 4-20-22 at 9:30 AM.
Adding Count 2 with Probable Cause Language and Adding Count 4 as to co-defendant.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
